page.title: 08A Church in a School,Knowle
page.content: There is no Anglican church in Bentley Heath so Bentley Heath Church of England School Hall is used. It was consecrated to St. James by the Bishop Of Aston in October 1983. There was no need for a church until the new housing estates led to a substantial population increase. The church was opened in Septmeber 1982 and monthly services were held until the consecration when services became fortnightly. From September 1985 the services will be weekly. About 50 adults and 25 children attend the services which are taken by Deaconess Saunders. Children's comments include "I like the coffee at the end." (Andrew Lang) and "The prayers and Holy Communium get boring." (William Pitt).
